verses.text: Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah , and made him king in his father’s stead in Jerusalem.
Jehoahaz \add was\add* twenty and three years old when he began to reign , and he reigned three months in Jerusalem.
And the king of Egypt put him down at Jerusalem , and condemned the land in an hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.\f + \fr 36.3 \ft put…: Heb. removed him\f*
And the king of Egypt made Eliakim his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem , and turned his name to Jehoiakim. And Necho took Jehoahaz his brother , and carried him to Egypt. \p

¶ Jehoiakim \add was\add* twenty and five years old when he began to reign , and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem : and he did \add that which was\add* evil in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* his God.
Against him came up Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon , and bound him in fetters , to carry him to Babylon.\f + \fr 36.6 \ft fetters: or, chains\f*
Nebuchadnezzar also carried of the vessels of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* to Babylon , and put them in his temple at Babylon.

Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim , and his abominations which he did , and that which was found in him, behold, they \add are\add* written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah : and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.\f + \fr 36.8 \ft Jehoiachin: also called, Jeconiah, or, Coniah\f* \p

¶ Jehoiachin \add was\add* eight years old when he began to reign , and he reigned three months and ten days in Jerusalem : and he did \add that which was\add* evil in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And when the year was expired , king Nebuchadnezzar sent , and brought him to Babylon , with the goodly vessels of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and made Zedekiah his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem.\f + \fr 36.10 \ft when…: Heb. at the return of the year\f*\f + \fr 36.10 \ft goodly…: Heb. vessels of desire\f*\f + \fr 36.10 \ft Zedekiah…: or, Mattaniah, his father’s brother\f* \p
¶ Zedekiah \add was\add* one and twenty years old when he began to reign , and reigned eleven years in Jerusalem.

And he did \add that which was\add* evil in the sight of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* his God , \add and\add* humbled not himself before Jeremiah the prophet \add speaking\add* from the mouth of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

And he also rebelled against king Nebuchadnezzar , who had made him swear by God : but he stiffened his neck , and hardened his heart from turning unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel. \p

¶ Moreover all the chief of the priests , and the people , transgressed very much after all the abominations of the heathen ; and polluted the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* which he had hallowed in Jerusalem.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of their fathers sent to them by his messengers , rising up betimes , and sending ; because he had compassion on his people , and on his dwelling place :\f + \fr 36.15 \ft by: Heb. by the hand of\f*\f + \fr 36.15 \ft betimes: that is, continually and carefully\f*

But they mocked the messengers of God , and despised his words , and misused his prophets , until the wrath of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* arose against his people , till \add there was\add* no remedy.\f + \fr 36.16 \ft remedy: Heb. healing\f*

Therefore he brought upon them the king of the Chaldees , who slew their young men with the sword in the house of their sanctuary , and had no compassion upon young man or maiden , old man , or him that stooped for age : he gave \add them\add* all into his hand.

And all the vessels of the house of God , great and small , and the treasures of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and the treasures of the king , and of his princes ; all \add these\add* he brought to Babylon.
And they burnt the house of God , and brake down the wall of Jerusalem , and burnt all the palaces thereof with fire , and destroyed all the goodly vessels thereof.

And them that had escaped from the sword carried he away to Babylon ; where they were servants to him and his sons until the reign of the kingdom of Persia :\f + \fr 36.20 \ft them…: Heb. the remainder from the sword\f*

To fulfil the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* by the mouth of Jeremiah , until the land had enjoyed her sabbaths : \add for\add* as long as she lay desolate she kept sabbath , to fulfil threescore and ten years. \p

¶ Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia , that the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add spoken\add* by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished , the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia , that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom , and \add put it\add* also in writing , saying ,

Thus saith Cyrus king of Persia , All the kingdoms of the earth hath the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of heaven given me; and he hath charged me to build him an house in Jerusalem , which \add is\add* in Judah. Who \add is there\add* among you of all his people ? The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* his God \add be\add* with him, and let him go up.
